00020 #define DIG_DEF_NUMFRAMES 4
00021 #define DIG_DEF_INPUT     0

00023 #define DIG1394_FIRST_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)0)
00024 #define DIG1394_SECOND_CAMERA  (~(unsigned long long)1)
00025 #define DIG1394_THIRD_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)2)
00026 #define DIG1394_FOURTH_CAMERA  (~(unsigned long long)3)
00027 #define DIG1394_FIFTH_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)4)
00028 #define DIG1394_SIXTH_CAMERA   (~(unsigned long long)5)
00029 #define DIG1394_SEVENTH_CAMERA (~(unsigned long long)6)
00030 #define DIG1394_EIGHTH_CAMERA  (~(unsigned long long)7)
00031 
00032 #define DIG1394_NTH_CAMERA(n)  (~(unsigned long long)(n))
00033 
00034 /*
00035   parameter format for XVDig1394::set_params is a string of "XnXn..."
00036   where X is the parameter character and n is the corresponding value
00037   valid characters and their values:
00038   B : number of buffers ( same as defined in XVVideo.h )
00039   R : pixel format from camera, 0 = YUV422, 1 = RGB, 2 = MONO8,
00040                                 3 = MONO16, 4 = YUV411, 5 = YUV444
00041                     default = 0 
00042   S : scale, 0 = any, 1 = 640x480, 2 = 320x200, 3 = 160x120, 
00043              4 = 800x600, 5 = 1024x768, 6 = 1280x960, 7 = 1600x1200
00044           default = 0
00045   M : scale (obsolete), M0 = S4, M1 = S5, M2 = S6, M3 = S7
00046   C : whether to grab center of the image or not, 0 = no, 1 = yes, default = 0
00047       note that C1 implies format 7
00048   T : external trigger, 0 = off, 1-4 = mode 0-3, or directly supply the
00049                         number to the camera. default = 0
00050   f : directly set IEEE 1394 camera format (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00051       if the value is 7, S values are still used.
00052   m : directly set IEEE 1394 camera mode   (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00053       note that this parameter should not to set for format 7
00054   r : frame rate, 0 = 1.875, 1 = 3.75, 2 = 7.5, 3 = 15, 4 = 30, 5 = 60 (fps)
00055                   default = fastest under selected format and mode
00056   g : gain
00057   u : u component for the white balance
00058   v : v component for the white balance
00059   s : saturation
00060   A : sharpness
00061   h : shutter
00062   a : gamma
00063   x : exposure
00064   o : optical filter
00065   i : bus init (resets the IEEE bus)
00066  */
00067 
00068 
00069 template <class IMTYPE>
00070 class XVDig1394 : public XVVideo<IMTYPE> {
00071  protected:
00072   using XVVideo<IMTYPE>::size ;
00073   using XVVideo<IMTYPE>::image_buffers ;

00113                 camera_id=0);
